title: Mission Description
content: You come to an agreement: GiveClarahalf of the painkillers to take back for the vagrants.Even though Natasha isn't the type of person to lose her mind over something like this, you still feel a little bad and troubled...How will Natasha react to this? Guess you'll have to ask her personally to find out.

speaker: Seele
line: Nat! We're back.

speaker: Natasha
line: Hehe, that's our Seele. Nothing if not punctual. So, did you find any usable supplies?

text: (SubmitBox of Rubbing Alcohol×1,Box of Special Painkillers×1,  andBox of Metal Plates and Bandages×1)

speaker: Natasha
line: Let me see... metal plates, gauze bandages, painkillers, rubbing alcohol... Perfect, that's everything I needed.

speaker: Natasha
line: Huh... It's just, there are less painkillers than I'd expected. Did someone break into the storage room?

text: Monsters had destroyed some of them.

children.speaker: Seele
children.line: Hey, no need to lie, Nat wouldn't be upset about what we did.

children.speaker: Seele
children.line: Clara had already arrived at the storage room by the time we got there. We split the painkillers with her.

speaker: Natasha
line: ...If she was there too then... I understand. She wants to look after the injured vagrants, right? Clara's always been a kind-hearted girl...

speaker: Natasha
line: I think you made the right decision. Still, it means I'm going to have to draw up a detailed dosage plan.

speaker: Seele
line: Hey, don't worry. I'll help you.

speaker: Natasha
line: Um, no need. I'll handle the clinic. I assume you three have more important things to be getting on with, right? Oleg will be waiting, not to mention your two companions.

text: I'd nearly forgotten about those two.

children.speaker: Bronya
children.line: So you guys aren't that close after all? I thought you were sworn friends.

children.speaker: Natasha
children.line: ▶ Haha, you're adorable, Bronya. (Trailblazer) was obviously joking~

text: I forgot to say anything to them before I left...

children.speaker: Natasha
children.line: I'm sure they won't mind, they seemed in good spirits.

speaker: Seele
line: I bet old Oleg wants to talk about Svarog . We should get going — sorry Nat, we'll have to leave the wounded to you.

speaker: Natasha
line: No worries, I hope things go smoothly.

text: Meet up with companions and Oleg

title: Step Description
content: Natasha tells you thatMarch 7thandDan Hengare with Oleg, the chief ofWildfire. Seems like your companions have been busy with work during your time away...At least they didn't leave you behind and go hide-and-seek or earn a little pocket money at the boxing gym this time...Anyways, head out and meet up with your companions and see how their work is going.

speaker: Bronya
line: *yawn*

speaker: Seele
line: Huh? Tired already?

speaker: Bronya
line: Aren't you? We didn't get any rest last night.

speaker: Seele
line: You're gonna have to step it up, y'know. My record is six days no shut-eye.

speaker: March 7th
line: Hey, they're finally back!

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Ha, that's nothing — the unannounced disappearance record-holder is right here!

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: And that's something to be proud of?

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: ...Uh, I wasn't worried about you. If you must know, I was wondering if Bronya was okay.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: Oh please — you've barely sat still since they left.

speaker: Oleg
line: Hahaha, it's good to have everyone back together. Let me get straight to it...

speaker: Oleg
line: Regarding this " Stellaron " and your predicament in the Overworld , your friends have gone over both with me again.

speaker: Oleg
line: The last time I saw Cocolia , she was an impressive young lady... I never thought that after becoming the guardian ...

speaker: Oleg
line: All I can say is that I sympathize with your situation. Rest easy. Wildfire won't go behind your back on this.

speaker: Oleg
line: Your plan sounds a bit like the ravings of a drunken miner, but at least you're offering a road forwards. We Underworlders haven't had a road to anywhere for a long time now, and you can see how things have become. I'm willing to give you guys a shot.

speaker: March 7th
line: Don't worry, Mr. Oleg, we'll make sure you don't regret it!

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Ravings of a drunken miner is a little harsh.

speaker: Oleg
line: Maybe it is! But I think we need to set our sights on something a bit more realistic. You guys want to know the whereabouts of the Stellaron. Wildfire wants to remove the restrictions on the Underworld ...

speaker: Oleg
line: In other words, Svarog is the target of both our efforts. If we can't deal with the boss, we can't deal with anything.

text: You're right. Let's go take him down!

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: Diplomacy before violence. We should try peaceful communication first.

children.speaker: Oleg
children.line: Both your approaches have merit. We would always rather avoid losses and settle matters through peaceful means. But if the situation changes, we must be prepared for armed conflict at a moment's notice.

text: We need to find a way to bring him over to our side.

children.speaker: Seele
children.line: Hmph, he wouldn't understand — you're forgetting he's a robot. It'd be faster to smash him to scrap metal!

children.speaker: Oleg
children.line: We should make preparations for both approaches. Of course, it's better to settle matters through peaceful means. But if the situation changes, we must be prepared for armed conflict at a moment's notice.

speaker: Oleg
line: Wildfire has tried many times to make contact with Svarog — without success. He has no intention of engaging with us.

speaker: Oleg
line: At our current strength, it would be incredibly dangerous to use force. Svarog's robots don't fear sacrifice, and I don't want to risk Underworld lives.

speaker: Oleg
line: But things have changed — your arrival constitutes an "external variable" for Svarog. I may not have the full picture, but perhaps you guys have an opportunity to sway him.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: That would be best.

speaker: Oleg
line: Hahahaha! Our scheme is coming along nicely! But I fear that Svarog just isn't the swaying type. *sigh* You'll understand when you get to his territory. Things never run smoothly down here.

speaker: Oleg
line: What about you, Miss Silvermane? You're the only one here that isn't compelled to do or die with Svarog. I'd like to hear your plan.

speaker: Bronya
line: The Underworld is still a part of Belobog . If Svarog's existence constitutes a threat to the people here, I will of course stand with you.

speaker: Oleg
line: Hahaha, excellent! An enlightened answer, young lady — and spoken like a true successor to the guardianship.

speaker: Oleg
line: Seeing as we're all on the same side, there's no reason to delay. Let's go, I've arranged for a guide to take you to Svarog.

speaker: Oleg
line: Wildfire's relationship with Svarog has been hostile for a long time now, accompanying you would only lead to misunderstandings. We'll be nearby, awaiting orders. If things go south, we'll be there in no time.

speaker: Oleg
line: Seele, perhaps you can take our outsider friends the rest of the way.

speaker: Seele
line: Mm, I'm on it, boss.
